critique: This document is an executive order from 1931 that removes land from the Tongass National Forest in Alaska and restores it to entry under public land laws. It seems to be related to land management and resource allocation. There is no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration policy, executive power expansion, or impacts on national security vs. civil liberties. It could be argued that returning land to private hands favors deregulation, but the impact is minimal. Similarly, the impact on federalism and social inclusion is negligible.
